title: Simplify Dashboard Lease Listing Editor Required Fields

requirements.summary: Simplify the Create/Edit Lease Listing dialog so only Listing ID, Lease Code, and Split Ratio are required, and remove Location/Area/Capacity from the primary required UI/validation.
acceptanceCriteria: Creating a listing from the dashboard succeeds when only Listing ID + Lease Code + Split Ratio are provided by the user (no Location/Area/Capacity input required).
The form no longer blocks submission with the error "Please fill in all required fields" due to missing Location/Area/Capacity.
User-facing labels and helper text remain in English.

file_operations.description: Update the dialog form to make Listing ID, Lease Code (UUID), and Split Ratio (NLO/ULO) the only required user inputs; remove Location/Area/Capacity from the primary form UI and from the required-field validation (optionally place them into a clearly-labeled optional/advanced section that does not affect submit eligibility). Update labels/helper text so Lease Code and Split Ratio are no longer marked optional, and ensure the generic required-fields toast is no longer triggered by missing Location/Area/Capacity.

requirements.summary: On submit, automatically supply safe defaults for Location/Area/Capacity so create/update calls remain valid without user entry, while keeping UUID and split ratio validation.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the simplified form calls the existing actor methods (createLeaseListing/updateLeaseListing) without backend validation/trap errors due to missing Location/Area/Capacity.
Lease Code UUID validation still works (invalid UUIDs are rejected with a clear inline error).
Split Ratio validation still works (invalid ratios are rejected with a clear inline error).

file_operations.description: Adjust submit handler to (1) require and validate Lease Code as a UUID with inline error, (2) require and validate Split Ratio with inline error, and (3) when Location/Area/Capacity are blank, automatically pass safe defaults to mutations (e.g., location="Unspecified", area=0n, capacity=0n) while preserving user-entered Listing ID, Lease Code, and Split Ratio; ensure the mutations still receive valid types (BigInt for area/capacity, and non-null code/splitRatio when required).
